attributes.Main objectives: Collection of recovery guidance notes and knowledge documents by sector
attributes.Institute: Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery (GFDRR)
attributes.Focus Area: Health, Education, Social Protection, Transport, Energy,

attributes.Main objectives: A research group that focuses on three areas:Climate change and risk,Gender, marginalization and insecurity,Prosperity and peace
attributes.Focus Area: Climate change and risk, Gender,Private sector's contribution to peace,Complexity and fragility,Financing for peacebuilding and ODA,Mobility and migration,Peacebuilding and violent extremism, Sustainable Development Goal indicators,
attributes.Type of Document: Reports and Policy Briefs (Forum), Research papers
attributes.Notes: the Forum's reports could be of interest

attributes.Main objectives: Extend the Centre's work on Aid Effectiveness in the context of fragility. Angle from the U.S. Millennium Challenge Account.
attributes.Focus Area: Understanding the causes and consequences of state fragility,Determining opportunities for policy intervention and the sequencing of such interventions,Finding ways to improve the effectiveness of aid to fragile states,Identifying turning points that signal when donors should shift from post-conflict to longer-term development assistance.

attributes.Main objectives: Improve the U.S. government's approach to reducing global fragility
attributes.Institute: The United States Institute of Peace (USIP)
attributes.Focus Area: Fragility and resilience,aid policy

attributes.Main objectives: Studies the connections between the environment, health, population, development, conflict, and security.
attributes.Focus Area: Combating climate change in the context of fragility,Environmental security and peacebuilding,

attributes.Main objectives: Providing a framework that can enable policy makers and development practitioners to engage in fragile environments,Identifying the causes of state fragility
attributes.Group: Country Indicators for Foreign Policy project (CIFP)
attributes.Focus Area: Conflict Risk Assessment,Governance and democracy process,Failed and fragile states

attributes.Main objectives: The Center aims to explore, understand, and shape alternative futures of global change and human development. Initiated in the 1980s, it is today a hub of long-term forecasting and global trend analysis. Their analyses are based on a comprehensive modelling system (IF model).
attributes.Focus Area: "Taking Development (Im)Balance Seriously: Using New Approaches to Measure and Model State Fragility". More specifically, research questions are targeted at understanding what sets of conditions are necessary for popular grievances to spark abrupt socio-political change, such as the Arab Spring, as well as at identifying new ways of examining instability in countries.
attributes.Notes: work has not yet been published

attributes.Main objectives: Strengthen the evidence base and informing policy around livelihoods and services in conflict
attributes.Focus Area: State legitimacy,State capacity,Livelihood trajectories and economic activity,… in conflict-affected situations

attributes.Main objectives: Give a collective voice to conflict-affected states, and a platform for learning and support between member countries.
attributes.Focus Area: New Deal ImplementationPeer Learning and Cooperation

attributes.Main objectives: Platform for governments and partners to analyze recovery and peacebuilding activities and coordinate support for better planning and implementation
attributes.Focus Area: Country specific recovery and peacebuilding requirements,Implementation and financing arrangements
attributes.Notes: in collaboration with EU and UN

attributes.Main objectives: Intended to highlight key issues concerning military, social, and human security in Africa
attributes.Group: Africa Security Initiative (project under the Foreign Policy program)
attributes.Focus Area: Crises and conflicts,Illicit economies, Terrorism,
attributes.County/Regional focus: the Horn of Africa, Central and East Africa, Nigeria

attributes.Main objectives: GSDRC is a partnership of research institutes, think-tanks and consultancy organizations that provides applied knowledge services on demand and online. Expertise in issues of governance, social development, humanitarian response and conflict.
attributes.Institute: Governance and Social Development Resource Centre (GSDRC)
attributes.Focus Area: Development Pressures: climate change, food security, fragility, migration, population growth, urbanization,Conflict: analysis, prevention, response, sensitivity, impacts of conflict, peacebuilding,

attributes.Main objectives: Specialized team conducting applied, policy-oriented research and developing practical tools that assist national and multilateral governmental and non-governmental organizations in their engagement in fragile and conflict-affected situations.
attributes.Institute: Clingendael, Netherlands institute of International Relations
attributes.Focus Area: Crisis and Conflict Analysis,Politics and crime,Security and Justice,Economic development,Policy debates
attributes.County/Regional focus: not specified, yet many reports on the Sahel region

attributes.Main objectives: Monthly early warning bulletin designed to provide an update on the state of conflict around the world.
attributes.Focus Area: Country-specific conflict developments,
attributes.Notes: they also publish more in-depth analysis connected to fragility

attributes.Main objectives: To provide strategic support, build capacity and operate as a knowledge contributor to the Global Resilience Partnership,To develop methods, practice and actionable tools for integrating resilience into development,To  develop a resilience framework
attributes.Group: Guidance for Resilience in the Anthropocene: Investments for development (GRAID)
attributes.Focus Area: Resilience and development
attributes.County/Regional focus: Sahel, Horn of Africa,  South and Southeast Asia,

attributes.Main objectives: Approach Fragility, Conflict and Violence to address sources of instability and build resilience.
attributes.Focus Area: Knowledge, analytics and data, Forced displacement and development,Strategy and financial solutions,Operations and crisis response,Partnerships for peace

attributes.Main objectives: Portal on different Private Sector Development approaches that gathers knowledge products from a wide array of sources.
attributes.Institute: The Donor Committee for Enterprise Development (DCED)
attributes.Focus Area: Conflict, peace and the economy,
attributes.Notes: A large collection of papers relating to the topic of economy and conflict.

attributes.Main objectives: CPR’s mission is to generate policy research that informs major UN policy processes in the fields of peace and security, humanitarian affairs, and global development.
attributes.Focus Area: Aid assistance in fragile cities,UN development approach,Changing nature of violence and how security, humanitarian, and development actors have to adapt,

attributes.Main objectives: GFDRR provides knowledge, funding, and technical assistance to  help developing countries better understand and reduce their vulnerability to natural hazards and climate change, Implement the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction
attributes.Institute: Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery (GFDRR)
attributes.Focus Area: Disaster risk financing and insurance, Global program for safer schools, Inclusive Community Resilience,Resilient Recovery,Urban Resilience, Gender and disaster risk,

attributes.Main objectives: Help fragile and conflict-affected states achieve more inclusive and sustainable transitions out of war or authoritarianism,  Core work is to provide independent expert analysis and advice on integrated policy solutions for locally-led efforts to break cycles of conflict or repression.
attributes.Focus Area: Transition Assistance,Inclusive Transitions,Law and Peace,Major Publications on:Aid in Transitions,Inclusive Transitions Framework,A Framework Guide for Foundation Engagement
attributes.Type of Document: Reports,Interactive Transition Map,Newspaper Articles

attributes.Main objectives: Fragility assessments aim to examine fragility issues and map out appropriate development interventions for ADB in consultation with the community.
attributes.Focus Area: Fragility assessments in selected urban settlements using a community-based approach and focusing on the impact of fragility on the delivery of basic services.
attributes.Notes: Complete results for ADB Fragility Index can be found in the ADB Economics Working Paper Series,Overview of Index here https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/publication/42814/fragility-index-differentiated-approach-fcas.pdf

attributes.Main objectives: Interactive tool to highlight country specific vulnerabilities and their capacity to  manage pressures in order to make  political risk assessment and early warning of conflict accessible to  policy-makers and the public at large.
attributes.Focus Area: Analysis of 12 indicators offragility

attributes.Main objectives: Aims to influence how aid and development policies are usedto tackle global poverty and other development challenges.
attributes.Focus Area: Global Aid Effectiveness,New solutions to deal with state fragility and conflict,Governance and Anti-Corruption,Reform of U.S. Global Development Efforts,
attributes.Notes: No specific study group on fragility thus only very broad focus on aid and  occasional work on fragility. But Global Program has plans for work on how to leave no country behind in the drive to end extreme poverty, but that project is in its very early stages.

attributes.Main objectives: The ISS is an African non-profit organization with offices in South Africa, Kenya, Ethiopia and Senegal. Work covers transnational crimes, migration, maritime security and development, peacekeeping, peacebuilding, crime prevention and criminal justice, and the analysis of conflict and governance.
attributes.Focus Area: Conflict, peace and governance,Crime and justice,Peace operations and peacebuilding,Transnational threats and international crime,
attributes.Notes: Also have an interactive map on crime in South Africa, Crime Hub

attributes.Main objectives: Community based approach to peacebuilding by providing training, advice and support to local populations. Advice to companies, governments, and Int. Org.
attributes.Focus Area: Gender,Environment and climate change,Economic development,Natural resource management,Crime, violence and instability,State-citizen relations

attributes.Main objectives: Aims to  explore innovative approaches to emerging challenges in the field of security and rule of law in fragile and conflict affected contexts.
attributes.Group: Security & Rule of Law in Conflict-Affected Settings
attributes.Institute: The Knowledge Platform Security & Rule of Law
attributes.Focus Area: Human-security,Employment for stability,Influence of transnational challenges on fragility,Embedding justice in power and politics,
attributes.Notes: funded by the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs

attributes.Main objectives: Center that explores governance, development, and state building in fragile states, bringing together authors who work on these issues in think tanks, government, academia, and the media.
attributes.Focus Area: Causes of fragility,Development strategies,Capacity building,Poverty reduction,Aid policy,Elite incentives,Social cohesion,Public goods
attributes.Notes: Headed by Seth Kaplan, leading scholar and lecturer at Johns Hopkins University

attributes.Main objectives: Think tank dedicated to developing metrics to analyze peace and to quantify its economic value. It does this by developing global and national indices, calculating the economic cost of violence, analyzing country level risk and understanding positive peace.
attributes.Focus Area: Measuring Peace,Positive Peace,Economics of Peace, Understanding Risk

attributes.Main objectives: Presenting quarterly analytical reviews of resilience literature, social media activity, and key resilience-related events, as well as collating the views of diverse resilience experts.
attributes.Focus Area: Resilience

attributes.Main objectives: We deliver high quality research, analysis and policy advice on the distribution of risk, the impacts of climate, weather extremes and other hazards on poverty and development, and the political economy of managing risk and building resilience.
attributes.Focus Area: Risk management and resilience-building approaches across donors and national and sub-national government departments (focus on water, agriculture and finance/planning sectors),Link climate scientists, social scientists and decision-makers,Sendai Framework, Paris Agreement, SDGs,

attributes.Main objectives: Guide policy by pointing to recent advances in research,Encourage new research by highlighting critical areas of knowledge missing about economic growth in fragile and conflict situations.
attributes.Group: LSE-Oxford Commission on State Fragility, Growth and Development
attributes.Focus Area: Building legitimate government,Generating effective state capacity,Promoting private sector development,Establishing security and reducing conflict,Building resilience to shocks,
attributes.Notes: David Cameron is the Chair, will only run until June 2018

attributes.Main objectives: A research group that studies different kinds of armed conflict, how they unfold and what their consequences are. It also examines peacekeeping missions, working to improve their efficiency and cooperation.
attributes.Focus Area: Multilateral Peace Operations Database collects data on global peace operations (2000 onwards)
attributes.County/Regional focus: Asia, Europe,Mali,Russia and Eurasia

attributes.Main objectives: Aims to shape the policy debate on how to improve global economic cooperation and fightglobal poverty and sources of social stress.
attributes.Focus Area: US foreign aidDevelopment issues (broad)Fragility (marginal)
attributes.Notes: very broad focus on development only occasional work on fragility

attributes.Main objectives: Improving the existing European coordination mechanisms in Fragile States.
attributes.Focus Area: Link between security and development,Resilience and Linking Relief, Rehabilitation and Development,Disaster Risk reduction interventions

attributes.Main objectives: Leading the Bank’s mandate in fragile situationsProviding inputs into programming and operational documents
attributes.Focus Area: Drivers and Dynamics of Fragility in Africa,Estimating the Economic Cost of Fragility in Africa,Natural Resources
attributes.County/Regional focus: regional member countries in the Horn of Africa, the Sahel,  the Mano River Union (MRU).

attributes.Main objectives: Provide evidence-based policy and action on complex security, justice and development challenges,Undertake diagnostics and co-design solutions with public and private partners, often with the use of new technologies.
attributes.Focus Area: Drug policy,Citizen security,Building peace,Safer cities,Cyber security
attributes.Notes: Developed a series of practical applications in the fields of policing, arms mapping, homicide among others.

attributes.Main objectives: Designing, delivering, and monitoring projects in fragile states,Technical and project management hub, feeding practical insights from the field into the design and delivery of fragile states programming worldwide.
attributes.Group: Center for Secure and Stable States
attributes.Focus Area: Political Transition,Stability and resilience,Countering extremism
